page.title: 01 General Description
page.content: Between 4 and 7 miles SE of central London,the area includes the valleys of the Ravensbourne and the Quaggy,the grassy plateau of Blackheath in the NE, Hilly Fields in the W and Blythe Hill in the SW.It has always been an area through which people have passed to and from Kent and the Channel Ports. In the 19th century it became a dormitory area for the expanding metropolis.It is an area of social and ethnic contrast. Deptford is a socially deprived area. Brockley has a large West Indian and Asian population, and Blackheath islargely middle-class.During the 1960 Lewisham developed as the main shopping centre for the whole area. Consequently many of the surrounding shopping centres have declined.
